Articles.Content: Thank you for catching that. I updated MM and cleared its cache but exact same crash still happens
Is this in your Steamfolder or in a local copy? Does KSP crash without those mods?
It’s a local copy and no KSP only crashes specifically if OPM is installed. Other Kopernicus mods load fine as well.

Okay this is just really bizarre. I removed the CTTP folder from my Gamedata and now it loads fine every time. Put it back in? Crashes... At this point I'm just gonna make do without the high quality textures. Idek what the problem could be I literally have no other mods installed besides dependencies.
Maybe your CTTP files got corrupted. I'd try redownloading them and see if that works. Another option if you have the Steam version is to validate the main game files, in case those got corrupted.

Alright I reinstalled CTTP separately instead of relying on the one that I originally got from OPM. It works now which is insane because that whole folder is just textures and OPM bundles the latest release of CTTP but maybe you're right that they got corrupted somehow. Thank you everyone!
does this work with Rescale?

1 hour ago, Galileo chiu said:

does this work with Rescale?

It should work fine, since Rescale is using Sigma Dimensions. I use Sigma Dimensions to play a 2.7x rescaled Kerbin system, and I have OPM installed - all planets resized and rescaled without issues.
Is this mod going to get updated to 1.12.2?
It already works in 1.12.2 today.

41 minutes ago, kerbalcommander563 said:

Is this mod going to get updated to 1.12.2?

Many mods, and particularly planet packs, don't require updating when KSP updates.  As long as Kopernicus is updated, planet packs should work, so there's usually no need to wait for the authors to release an update or officially announce that it's compatible.  If you want to try a mod, just install it is and see what happens (though it may be a wise precaution to try it in a new game before using it in a current save).

9 hours ago, OhioBob said:

Many mods, and particularly planet packs, don't require updating when KSP updates.  As long as Kopernicus is updated, planet packs should work, so there's usually no need to wait for the authors to release an update or officially announce that it's compatible.  If you want to try a mod, just install it is and see what happens (though it may be a wise precaution to try it in a new game before using it in a current save).

ok, I did not know that

7 hours ago, kerbalcommander563 said:

ok, I did not know that

I’ve been using this mod just fine since 1.12 came out. Your game will (probably) be fine, just make sure you make a backup first

I have a very serious and concerning question for you, @Poodmund. What is the deal with Thatmo and random types of fruits?

5/10 experiments from the dathomir plains seem to be related to some kind of fruit, most promient being cantilope.

I'm confuzed.
Have you seen a Cantaloupe Melon?
I've just loaded up ksp with the new scatterer release, and am getting some funkiness that might require fixing (I know opm doesn't officially hold compatibility for 1.12 in the title)
OPM doesn't provide EVE or Scatterer support. Go raise it with whatever mod provides it.
Ah my mistake, almost got it in the right thread though .

Hello great mod but I'm having an issue with the career mode there are no comets or asteroids that spawn if you like I can take a screen shot of my mods I have about 10 years or so on the Kerbal clock so no rush but I know sooner or later I'm going to receive the comet one to track a comet so is this just my problem or is it a mod problem?
It's a kopernicus setting. On mobile right now so can't really check what it's supposed to be, but you can check the kopernicus thread.

21 hours ago, flekota said:

Hello great mod but I'm having an issue with the career mode there are no comets or asteroids that spawn if you like I can take a screen shot of my mods I have about 10 years or so on the Kerbal clock so no rush but I know sooner or later I'm going to receive the comet one to track a comet so is this just my problem or is it a mod problem?

There is a mod called "customAsteroids" which allows for more customizability in Asteroid spawning. There also are configs specially made for opm.

41 minutes ago, KawaiiLucy said:

There is a mod called "customAsteroids" which allows for more customizability in Asteroid spawning. There also are configs specially made for opm.

And to further this point, there was a discussion in the Custom Asteroids thread about OPM specifically if you want some aspects of the stock system to work alongside CA. I followed the directions on my latest save and it worked out well.
Hello! would like to know if this mod functions (and resizes properly) with JNSQ

2 hours ago, moguy said:

Hello! would like to know if this mod functions (and resizes properly) with JNSQ

No, OPM does not work with JNSQ.  The only planet packs, to my knowledge, that have been modified to work with JNSQ are GPP and GEP (all by the same developers).  However, these planet packs are added to the JNSQ universe as secondary star systems.  There is nothing that adds planets to the JNSQ solar system.

That being said, there's no reason configs couldn't be written that would make OPM compatible with JNSQ.  However, JNSQ and OPM really aren't a very good fit stylistically.
